text: port this to firefox, por favor

that’s 2 :firefox: votes <@U26D0TF8E> lol
<@UD53A9UUR> if we get a significant number of people wanting a firefox version we will do it.

The reason we don’t have one yet - it requires modifying our code to work for both platforms(I’ve looked into it, it is possible to have the same codebase for both) - It also requires every time we are ready to push an update live, we will need to do that in 2 places, the chrome web store and Firefox’s platform.

It also means we need to actively test in both browsers, meaning we will be slower to release updates.  If we had a dev that primarily used Firefox and was willing to contribute toward making it happen it’d be much easier.
i though there was a wrapper for chrome ext to work in firefox.
I’ve seen a tool like that online and tried to use it but it errored out. no idea why
hmmm
when i have free time…
this makes it seem pretty straightforward:  <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Porting_a_Google_Chrome_extension>

yea, as I’ve said it’s doable, and we can do it with the same codebase, it’s just a bit of upfront work and an ongoing maintenance and testing issue.

we currently don’t have a way to auto-deploy the extension from github to the chrome web store, nor do we have a way to auto-deploy to firefox, and we don’t have a way of auto testing the submission process. (chrome store submission can fail when certain criteria are not met)
fun
If that could be automated it would make maintaining it much more feasible. as a small unpaid team
doesnt webpack just magically do all of that :slightly_smiling_face:
‘make firefox: true’
pretty sure that solved it
de nada
haha, wish it were that simple.
If you wanna give your hand at it, though I’d be all for it and would try to help where I can.

so in about 12 years

haha, yea I hear ya. my workload has been perpetually a mountain for the last practically year - no momentary breaks. I work on the extension late at night and on weekends mostly.

It’s been a rewarding experience though, so I keep making small changes over time and eventually those changes make it into beta, then eventually in to the stable build
and i thank you for it.  i like it enough that i keep a chrome window open for it.  bout the only time i use chrome anymore
